tweets.html:
Why do so many TV shows make fake-looking computer-program screens? The world is run by nerds. We notice this stuff.

— David Blue (@DavidBlue) March 23, 2011

Ok, that ep of No Ordinary Family ended with the 2 worst plot twists in TV history. Wow. ABC should just air both remaining eps on Saturday.

— Tim (@rural_juror) March 23, 2011

I'd read the bit about The Kennedys being an 8-part miniseries, but it just sunk in that it's really 8 freaking parts...

— Maggie Furlong (@MaggieFurlong) March 23, 2011

@TheTVShowGirl It just confirms my long-held theory that the Kennedys were 1.6X more story-worth than Mildred Pierce.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 23, 2011

When old-time stars die, I bet Robert Osborne feels great sadness followed by joy that he's got a gig doing their retrospective. #TCM

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) March 23, 2011

New meme in the making: regrettable final tweets. RT @ANIMALNewYork: Liz Taylor‚Äôs Last Tweet http://dlvr.it/LCp9R

I'm just glad Elizabeth Taylor lived long enough to see Rebecca Black's video.

— Paul Scheer (@paulscheer) March 23, 2011

Uh ... that sounds like a pretty gruesome slideshow, New York Times. http://twitpic.com/4cmwow

— Josh Fruhlinger (@jfruh) March 24, 2011

Pretending I'm on Top Chef. Wondering what culinary masterpiece I can make out of a half-eaten knish, two taco sauce packets, & a lollipop.

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) March 23, 2011

Study: Watching Fewer Than Four Hours Of TV A Day Impairs Ability To Ridicule Pop Culture http://onion.com/aWZ9aV #OnionTVReport

— The Onion (@TheOnion) March 23, 2011

I've spelled it Shrute in every single script I've written since Hot Girl. Have I been wrong this whole time? @KenTremendous? @icecubetray?

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) March 23, 2011

@mindykaling yes, but the real question is do you spell his first name "Dwigt"?

— Andrea Reiher (@andrea_reiher) March 23, 2011

@mindykaling Yes. S-c-h-r-u-t-e. Don't worry -- it's not like you've been writing lines for that character since 2004.

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) March 23, 2011

@KenTremendous this is legit mortifying. I guess you have a leg up on its spelling cuz you're in the S(c)hrute clan. #mose

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) March 23, 2011

The enemy of my enemy of my enemy of my enemy of my enemy is Kevin Bacon.

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) March 23, 2011

I wouldn't kick any promotion out of bed, but if you're expecting a "Pulp Fiction Spoof" tomorrow, start being disappointed now.

— Dan Harmon (@danharmon) March 23, 2011

I want to have sex with everyone on Community and Parks and Rec, and marry everyone on Bob's Burgers. #TVLove

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) March 23, 2011

@barbhaynes i grind against the teevee for half an hour whenever Community's on.

— Untold Entertainment (@UntoldEnt) March 23, 2011

At Breaking Bad set. Fulfilling a dream of my Bugs Bunny watching childhood, I finally did make a left turn at Albuquerque.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 23, 2011

Rebecca Black on Jay Leno: The ultimate meeting of the unintentionally hilarious and the unintentionally unhilarious.

— God (@TheTweetOfGod) March 23, 2011

I like Zach on The Good Wife (tho I prefer him with scheming Becca), but I wouldn't object if they wanted to send Grace to boarding school.

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) March 23, 2011

Theres no process more humiliating & demoralizing in media than trying to promote a book as a non celebrity. Makes me depressed everyday.

— David Sirota (@davidsirota) March 23, 2011

Wouldnt it be awesome if ABC made a full on commitment to revitalize all 3 soaps?

— Jamey_Giddens (@Jamey_Giddens) March 23, 2011

Two of my students this semester have partied with cast members of Jersey Shore. I expect this number only to rise in subsequent semesters.

— MŒ±tt ThomŒ±s (@mattthomas) March 23, 2011

Aren't you guys embarrassed to still be using Twitter now that "Shit My Dad Says" got cancelled?

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) March 23, 2011

30 more followers. That's all @ShawnRyanTV needs to unveil his revenge on the man who had him arrested.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) March 23, 2011

Former SNL star Victoria Jackson rants that Glee is turning boys gay. I think Victoria Jackson is more to blame for that.

— George Takei (@GeorgeTakei) March 23, 2011

Watching 'Glee' doesn't make kids gay, Victoria Jackson. It makes them gayER. Get it right.

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) March 23, 2011

Victoria Jackson & Dennis Miller set for comedy tour this summer entitled, "Fags, Muslims and Other Folks We Stopped Tolerating After SNL."

— Simon Helberg (@simonhelberg) March 23, 2011

Can anyone who uses the phrase "jamming it down our throats" to express their objection to gays, REALLY NOT KNOW WHAT THEY'RE SAYING?!

— Ken Pisani (@kpsmartypants) March 23, 2011

Sick and tired of seeing heterosexual kissing scenes on TV, how are my kids supposed to grow up gay? They are ramming it down our throats!!

— Ian Bisset (@The6thDoctor) March 23, 2011

tweets.author_name: Too much of a good thing is wonderful.
tweets.html:
Victoria Jackson's fears are misplaced. I can't think of any gay thing that wants to be shoved down her particular throat.

— Too much of a good thing is wonderful. (@phyllisstein) March 23, 2011

Regrets answering Victoria Jackson's prayers about getting on SNL. #100factsaboutGod

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) March 24, 2011

Paz de la Huerta is exponentially hotter after her bar fight with a reality "star." A thrown glass. Punches. Ah, dangerous women.

four episodes of #glee back to back.So much teen angst, so many shit songs. Thriller rocked, however.

If you ask me, the lyrics in that Rebecca Black song aren't even that good.

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) March 23, 2011

looks like we may get the SOA app onto the ANDROID this season. so now you android dweebs can crawl the fuck out of my ass. #PLATFORMENEMA

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) March 23, 2011

I wish I had someone in my phone book that would fit for my Clarissa Explains It All ringtone.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) March 23, 2011

The husband and I just discovered Reaper on Netflix IW. Deliciously bizarre but so misplaced. Seriously the CW in 2007?

— Kyra Hunting (@kohunting) March 24, 2011

Been watching Dateline. I could totally murder Christa and get away with it - those people are stupid. Don't start dating right away...

Seriously, if you're not watching The Ricky Gervais Show on @HBO, you're missing out on the profane, the mundane, and the insane. Brilliant.

"Why are people such assholes" she thinks, as she reads any comment section on the internet, anywhere.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 24, 2011

told myself I'd watch a whole episode of American Idol but it's Motown night and an Asian girl with no life experience is singing Heat Wave.

JLo is wearing gobs of blue eyeshadow & lipgloss and a dress covered in sequins but she doesn't look tacky she looks amazing. #girlcrush

NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NO #AmericanIdol

Haley should make every other constestant feel safe. This is some sub-Star Search shit up in here. #Idol

Watching tiVo'ed American Idol. Can't understand why people like this Casey dude; he's missing half the notes. Isn't this a singing contest?

Best thing abt work travel: "watching" #Idol via texts from my wife. On Casey tonite: "most frightening ex boyfriend ever."

Man I wanna be a judge. They let you sexually harass like crazy! #thingsIhavelearnedfromtelevision

Reason I can't watch #TopChef right now. Too much pressure. If Richard loses again, I will lose all faith in eating.

#hatemikeisabella #TopChef

Glenbearry Glen Ross - my new movie about bear salesmen - not a cgi pic. Real bears, we dub the voices. (Honey is for closers)

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

They hit bars with sticks in most movies to make them perform. But not in my pic. We just let them go and film them.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

No we don't animate the mouths. It's a real bear movie. We don't know what happens until we shoot it.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

Look, treat it like a joke, but mark my words. I will do something amazing with actual live bears.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

Bears.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

A "Pulp Fiction" Community, and Sorkin on 30 Rock? It's like NBC has been reading my sitcom/auteur slash fiction!

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) March 24, 2011

Woke up from tequila dream about my "bear project". Sorry to subject you all to that last night, but passion can't be held in, y'know?

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

Look, I don't need IDEAS for my bear project. I have idea and it's a winner: line for line remake of Glenbearry Glen Ross, but w. Bears.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

Now that I'm awake and sober, I feel people are trying to get me off this bear topic and back to tv: not happening. Bears.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) March 24, 2011

For future reference: Answering questions midday - sober Bill. Unable to get off topic of making movie with live bears at night - drunky.
